data.author: Isaac Newton
data.quote: I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.

data.author: Albert Einstein
data.quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.

data.author: Fred Hoyle
data.quote: Life cannot have had a random beginning ... The trouble is that there are about 2000 enzymes, and the chance of obtaining them all in a random trial is only one part in 10^40,000, an outrageously small probability that could not be faced even if the whole universe consisted of organic soup.

data.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg
data.quote: It is strange that only extraordinary men make the discoveries, which later appear so easy and simple.

data.author: Nicolaus Copernicus
data.quote: There may be babblers, wholly ignorant of mathematics, who dare to condemn my hypothesis, upon the authority of some part of the Bible twisted to suit their purpose. I value them not, and scorn their unfounded judgment.

data.author: John Archibald Wheeler
data.quote: There is no law except the law that there is no law.

data.author: Stephen Jay Gould
data.quote: We pass through this world but once. Few tragedies can be more extensive than the stunting of life, few injustices deeper than the denial of an opportunity to strive or even to hope, by a limit imposed from without, but falsely identified as lying within.

data.author: Thomas Chrowder Chamberlin
data.quote: Falsity in intellectual action is intellectual immorality.

data.author: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
data.quote: The black holes of nature are the most perfect macroscopic objects there are in the universe: the only elements in their construction are our concepts of space and time.

data.author: Isaac Asimov
data.quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

data.author: Albert Einstein
data.quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.

data.author: Charles Darwin
data.quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

data.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
data.quote: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.

data.author: Marie Curie
data.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

data.author: Galileo
data.quote: You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him discover it in himself.

data.author: Albert Einstein
data.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.

data.author: Oliver Heaviside
data.quote: Shall I refuse my dinner because I do not fully understand the process of digestion?

data.author: Stephen Hawking
data.quote: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.

data.author: Isaac Newton
data.quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants.

data.author: Edwin Powell Hubble
data.quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
